summary:
In Bangladesh diplomatic service (1995 -  ).
Served a good part of career in multilateral economic diplomacy. 

To date, served in Bangladesh Permanent Mission to UN (New York) (1999-2003); New Delhi (2003-05).
2005-11: worked on South Asian regional cooperation, including a stint at SAARC Secretariat (Kathmandu) as a Director. Dealt with regional agriculture and rural development, transport connectivity, SAARC Development Fund, development of regional projects. Also on development/re-organisation of regional institutions/ processes.
 
2012: as Director-General (Europe and EU Affairs) in HQs when shepherded Bangladeshâ€™s entry in ASEM.

2013-16: as Director-General (Multilateral Economic Affairs) worked on sustainable development, climate change, migration, development finance, multilateral trade, connectivity, water, blue economy. Steered Bangladesh's engagement in Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development. The lead interlocutor/negotiator on Bangladesh Sustainability Compact on Apparel and Textile industry; dealt with Responsible Business Conduct (OECD, G7). In the core team during Bangladesh Chairmanship of Global Forum for Migration and Development (GFMD). Bangladesh point man for Climate Vulnerable Forum (CVF) Troika (2012-14).

Anchored (2013-17) Bangladesh's engagement in Bangladesh-China-India-Myanmar Economic Corridor (BCIM EC). Point man on Bangladesh engagements at World Economic Forum (WEF).
 
High Commissioner of Bangladesh to Sri Lanka (2016-20). 

Ambassador of Bangladesh to the Netherlands (since July 2020), with concurrent accreditation to Bosnia & Herzegovina and Croatia. 
Also, Perm. Rep. to ICC, PCA, OPCW in The Hague.  

Interested in development, nature, climate change, sustainability, work, business, connectivity, water, technology. 
Keen to ideate and innovate.
